DisplayManager
public class BaseDisplayManager
extends Object
implements DisplayManager

This class is the implementation of a Map DisplayManager.

setExtentLimit

public void setExtentLimit(Envelope limit)
Description copied from interface: DisplayManager
Sets the Display's map extent limit. Once you set this property, future drawing of the Map is confined to the specified Envelope, and LayerExtensions associated with Layers in this Map will retrieve data within the confines of this property. You can switch off this behaviour by setting the extent limit property to null. You must redraw the Map to see the change caused by this property.

Specified by:
setExtentLimit in interface DisplayManager
Parameters:
limit - the new extent limit, or null == do not use an extent limit

getExtentLimit

public Envelope getExtentLimit()
Description copied from interface: DisplayManager
Returns the Display's current extent limit. If you get null, then this means that the extent limiting behaviour has been switched off - which is the default when the software starts.

Specified by:
getExtentLimit in interface DisplayManager
Returns:
the extent limit
See Also:
DisplayManager.setExtentLimit(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope)

isCancelled

public boolean isCancelled()
Description copied from interface: DisplayManager
Determines if the DrawingThread within the current Thread has been cancelled. This method is called frequently within the Renderer code.

Specified by:
isCancelled in interface DisplayManager
Returns:
true if cancellation has been detected, false otherwise
